newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: LG Metals shares plunge on LME talk.
newsitem.headline: LG Metals shares plunge on LME talk.

text.p: Shares of LG Metals Corp plunged during Monday trading on continuing rumours it faced trouble due to short positions on the London Metal Exchange (LME), brokers said.
According to local media reports, the company was facing large losses through its metal trading on the LME.
In early morning trading, LG Metals dropped by 5.6 percent, 800 won to 13,500.
It recovered to 13,800 won in the afternoon, off 500 won from the previous close of 14,300.
LG Metals' shares have been on a rollercoaster ride since last Thursday, when the rumours first began circulating on the Seoul bourse.

Last Thursday, the company said in a statement that no loss had been made from metals futures trading. It addded that the company had recorded 39.4 billion won ($46 million) profit from metals futures trading last year.
An LG Metals offical in charge of LME trading said the firm had not requested further credit lines from the exchange or received margin calls from brokers.

Traders in London have said the copper market was very tight, with nearby supply scarce and the premium over futures prices -- which must be paid for prompt delivery -- soaring. Large speculative shorts are having to pay high premiums to cover maturing positions which run up to mid-February.
